cyclone.name: ZETA
cyclone.current_location: about 305 mi SSE of the western tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking northwest, then north toward the northern Yucatan Peninsula on Monday and the central Gulf Coast (southeastern Louisiana–Mississippi area) late Wednesday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near southeastern Louisiana or the Mississippi coast (close to the New Orleans/Buras area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch from Tulum to Rio Lagartos, Mexico, including Cozumel
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning for Pinar del Rio, Cuba
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from central Louisiana eastward to Alabama
weather_observation.wind: Up to 30–40% chance of tropical-storm-force winds (≥39 mph) with a 9% chance of 50-kt winds at the port by late Wednesday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential storm surge exceeding 3 ft along southeastern Louisiana coast and lower Mississippi River passes
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches possible with locally higher amounts, creating flash-flood risk in the port area
weather_observation.other_hazards: Possible tornadoes in outer rain bands; river level rises and navigation restrictions along the Mississippi River channel
